value.title: DAX Fridays! #106: Power Query or DAX?
value.excerpt: If you already know, how about you share your thoughts here? If not, then I will share my thoughts in the topic.  There are no perfect answers, only good questions ;)  Happy Friday! value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #113: Unpivot tables with DAX
value.excerpt: Let me start by saying: "you shouldn't do it in DAX", but if you still have to do it, in this video I will show you how to unpivot tables with DAX.  I will then unpivot them using Power Query so you can see the difference, and how Power Query can be faster and more efficient for cleaning data.  Have

value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: Dax Fridays #211: Add leading zeros to a column using DAX
value.excerpt: Adding leading zeros, is probably something that you should do alrealy in Power Query, but in this case I wanted that column to be created on the fly rather than adding it to the model, so I let me show you how I did it!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX. value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column.  Link to Power BI file used in the video: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/search-dax
